articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: A year after their children were prescribed tainted medicines, families care for the survivors.
articles.title: When children take toxic cough syrup, and live

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's top planning body said on Saturday it had identified a second batch of public investment projects, including flood control and disaster relief programmes, under a bond issuance and investment plan announced in October to boost the economy.
articles.title: China identifies second set of projects in $140 bln spending plan

articles.author: Amlan Chakraborty
articles.description: The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI), battling a sexual harassment scandal, may need to safeguard women wrestlers to get its suspension lifted, the game's global governing body said on Saturday.
articles.title: Safeguarding India women wrestlers may be key to federation's return

articles.author: Ange Aboa
articles.description: Former Credit Suisse CEO Tidjane Thiam was elected on Friday as leader of the PDCI, one of Ivory Coast's main opposition parties, making him a likely candidate in the 2025 presidential election.
articles.title: Ex-Credit Suisse CEO elected to lead Ivory Coast's PDCI opposition party

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Friday his government will reinforce measures to contain migration as he seeks to help the United States cope with record numbers of people trying to reach the U.S. border.
articles.title: Mexico to boost measures aimed at curbing migration to US

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The United States on Friday reopened two rail crossings between Texas and Mexico vital for exports, five days after their closure in response to increased migrant traffic, and new U.S. data showed migrant numbers at the southern U.S. border remained high last month.
articles.title: US reopens Mexico rail crossings after closure sought to stem migration

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Poland's deputy infrastructure minister said on Friday that he hoped truckers' protests on the border with Ukraine could be solved before the end of the year.
articles.title: Poland hopes truckers dispute can be solved by year-end

articles.author: Michelle Nichols, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: The U.N. Security Council approved a toned-down bid to boost humanitarian aid to Gaza on Friday that stopped short of a call for a ceasefire, hours after Israel signalled it was widening its ground offensive in the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: UN pushes for more aid into Gaza, Israel widens offensive

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and military officials said the country's forces shot down three Russian Su-34 fighter-bomber aircraft on Friday on the southern front, hailing it as a success in the 22-month-old war.
articles.title: Ukraine claims to down three Russian fighter-bomber jets

articles.author: Wendell Roelf
articles.description: Shipping companies sailing around the Cape of Good Hope to avoid Houthi attacks on the Red Sea face tough choices over where to refuel and restock, as African ports struggle with red tape, congestion and poor facilities, companies and analysts say.
articles.title: Ships rerouted by Red Sea crisis face overwhelmed African ports
